column4: does this have anything to do w/ xorg not working on ppc w/ radeon? (sorry, came in a bit too late)
it uses fbdev by default at an unacceptable resolution, if I remove the option for fbdev, it won't sync the monitor and claims it can't read the option rom
xfree86 on debian and an older xorg on gentoo work fine using the radeon driver w/o fbdev
hm.  could you please file a bug with your Xorg.0.log and xorg.conf attached (from the pristine configuration)?
I don't have the pristine config, is there a utility I can run to remake one (X -configure doesn't work)
that didn't write a new xorg.conf, but I did a dpkg --purge of it and apt-get reinstalled, it's only white space difference from the xorg.conf I already uploaded to #6117
ok.  does sudo ddcprobe give you output ending in edidfail, or a whole bunch of spew about dtiming, ctiming, tec?
(what sort of monitor is it hooked up to?)
well, 6.8.1-11ubuntu13 might well solve your problem
happy to try, anywhere I can pull it from?
ok, I'll keep my fingers crossed and try to pull it tomorrow
